article.headline: George Mason 79, Hartford 58
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Mark Davis scored 20 points and Terry Reynolds added 17 to lead George Mason to a 79-58 win over Hartford on Thursday. The Patriots (4-1) hit a dozen 3-pointers in shooting 52 percent from behind the arc. Davis hit all three of his 3-point attempts and Reynolds made 5-of-8. George Mason sunk eight 3-pointers in the first half to build a 40-33 lead at the break. The Hawks (2-2) cut the lead to 46-42 on Aaron Cook's layup early in the second half, but the Patriots countered with a pair of fre throws and a 3-pointer from Reynolds regain control. George Mason led by as many as 23 points in the second half and held Hartford to seven field goals in the final 15 minutes. Ryan Stys led Hartford with 11 points and Cook finished with 10.
